caption:
This photograph depicts a scientific environment, likely a laboratory focused on marine or environmental sciences, as suggested by the maps of water bodies hung on the wall in the background. A person, visible from behind and to the side, is engaged in conducting an experiment or processing a sample. The individual is wearing a red short-sleeve shirt and is busy handling scientific equipment.

The workspace is cluttered with various laboratory equipment and tools. Visible apparatus includes a stirring device, large graduated cylinders, several flasks with different colored liquids (one particularly with a reddish liquid), and containers labeled possibly with sample information or chemical names. There is also an electronic device, likely a heating or mixing plate, branded "CORNING" with multiple dials, suggesting temperature or speed control.

The bench the person works on appears worn, covered with scattered papers and small equipment, emphasizing a busy and active research environment. The laboratory setup, combined with the nautical maps, implies analysis related to water quality, maritime studies, or similar fields emphasizing environmental assessments and research.
title: Mobile lab of the Southeast Water Laboratory in Athens, GA. The biologist is preparing a chemical analysis of the industrial waste being used in a static bioassay. This is part of a study of the continuous fishkill in Escambia Bay.
